intro: Pagamea capitata f. breviloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pagamea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its arid or semi-arid environment.
